experience.title: Senior Customer Success Manager
experience.description: Founded in 2017 by IIT-Delhi alumni, Attentive is a Sequoia backed startup with the no. 1 Sales Automation Software serving the outdoor services industry in the United States and Canada.• Managed a portfolio of $1M+ ARR, by personalized customer success strategies & proactive account management • Increased efficiency by 44%, streamlined customer success processes, automating tasks to save significant daily hours for CSM• Led pilot sales for a new software product, successfully closing deals with 25 clients, contributing to early market validation

experience.title: Founder
experience.description: Cross Skills is a skill-building & services platform for individuals and corporates.• Expansion of Cross Skills to 15+ cities; added network of 125+ interns from various colleges• Established a corporate vertical to start B2B Dealing for skill-building workshops• Automated the operations & workflow, managed the team of interns, reduced cost and increased profitsCross Skills is a passion-driven venture with a mission to create a sustainable and profitable network of people equipped with various professional skills and are looking to build a sustainable career around these skills and their passion. We do this by providing services for individuals and corporate organizations to achieve a work-life balance and increment in efficiency and productivity.

positions.subtitle: Toastmasters International
positions.description: The fourth ranking club officer, the Vice President of Public Relations (VPPR) is responsible for managing communication between the Club and its Community - both externally and internally - to communicate successes, explain challenges, and announce changes to maintain a positive image for the club; and to attract new members.• Promote the club to local media: newspapers, radio stations, television stations;• Produce and distribute a club newsletter at least monthly, oversee editor of club newsletter;• Maintain the club webpage, oversee club webmaster;• Promote membership drives and other programs.• Attend district-sponsored club officer training;
positions.title: Vice President Public Relations
positions.description_html:
The fourth ranking club officer, the Vice President of Public Relations (VPPR) is responsible for managing communication between the Club and its Community - both externally and internally - to communicate successes, explain challenges, and announce changes to maintain a positive image for the club; and to attract new members.
• Promote the club to local media: newspapers, radio stations, television stations;
• Produce and distribute a club newsletter at least monthly, oversee editor of club newsletter;
• Maintain the club webpage, oversee club webmaster;
• Promote membership drives and other programs.
• Attend district-sponsored club officer training;

experience.title: Intern
experience.description: • Selection for this Internship was through IIT Delhi's eDC (Entrepreneurship Development Cell) Business and Entrepreneurship Conclave, BECON 2018.• We were shortlisted from 3500+ participants based on resumes.• This program focused on understanding the functioning of the organization closely and interacting with employees to get our doubts clear.• This was followed by a Case Study about the Company where we used our Analytics and Decision Making Skills to present the answer to questions asked under the case study.• We got exclusive chance to interact with Ambrish Gupta (CEO, Knowlarity) and Ajay Shrivastava (CPO & CTO, Knowlarity) and asked their point of views about the strategies they follow in the organisation.• Interacted with HR and different members of Tech Team to know more about their work in product development and areas they specifically focus upon.• Apart from our academics in college, this opportunity made us know the practical aspects of a corporate organisation and real-world problem they face with or without any mistake committed by any of their members or in short unexpected circumstances.
experience.description_html: • Selection for this Internship was through IIT Delhi's eDC (Entrepreneurship Development Cell) Business and Entrepreneurship Conclave, BECON 2018.• We were shortlisted from 3500+ participants based on resumes.• This program focused on understanding the functioning of the organization closely and interacting with employees to get our doubts clear.• This was followed by a Case Study about the Company where we used our Analytics and Decision Making Skills to present the answer to questions asked under the case study.• We got exclusive chance to interact with Ambrish Gupta (CEO, Knowlarity) and Ajay Shrivastava (CPO & CTO, Knowlarity) and asked their point of views about the strategies they follow in the organisation.• Interacted with HR and different members of Tech Team to know more about their work in product development and areas they specifically focus upon.• Apart from our academics in college, this opportunity made us know the practical aspects of a corporate organisation and real-world problem they face with or without any mistake committed by any of their members or in short unexpected circumstances.
